alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Otoe (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 14 at 8:47PM CDT until April 14 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL JOHNSON AND SOUTHWESTERN OTOE COUNTIES... At 847 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles west of Unadilla to 4 miles northwest of Cook to 5 miles southwest of Tecumseh, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. These storms have a history of producing wind damage to power lines and road signs. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Palmyra around 850 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Cook. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
